abstract: Mikhail D. Prokhorov, a Russian billionaire, an amateur basketball player the size of an N.B.A. power forward, signed a tentative $200 million deal Wednesday that would make him the principal owner of the New Jersey Nets and an investor in the team’s new home, an arena planned for Brooklyn.
snippet: Mikhail D. Prokhorov, a Russian billionaire, an amateur basketball player the size of an N.B.A. power forward, signed a tentative $200 million deal Wednesday that would make him the principal owner of the New Jersey Nets and an investor in the tea...
lead_paragraph: A Russian billionaire, an amateur basketball player the size of an N.B.A. power forward, signed a tentative $200 million deal on Wednesday that would make him the principal owner of the New Jersey Nets and an investor in the team’s new home, an arena planned for Brooklyn, The New York Times’s Charles V. Bagli reported.

headline.main: Russian Billionaire Signs Deal to Buy the Nets
